sentences.english: It was found that the decrease of absorbance of guest-host cell is almost proportional to the exposure time and light intensity.
sentences.chinese: 發現賓主盒吸光度的減少幾乎正比於暴光時間和強度。

sentences.english: But the possibility exists that there are other contaminants that have not yet come to light.
sentences.chinese: 但是可能存在其他的污染物還未暴光。

sentences.english: I will have your website shut down if you (journalist) dare to report it.
sentences.chinese: 您假定敢正在您們網站暴光，我便叫它啓閉。

sentences.english: The secret enquiry this time is aimed at completely exposing the underside of society.
sentences.chinese: 這次暗訪一定要把社會的陰暗面全部暴光。

sentences.english: However, this change in behavior was independent of light exposure.
sentences.chinese: 然而，這個行爲改變與暴光無關。

sentences.english: Photographers use light meters to measure the amount of light that is reflected from the object they want to photograph.
sentences.chinese: 攝影師用暴光表，測量從被攝物體反射回的光的強度。

definition: to expose (photography)/(fig.) to expose (a scandal)/(advertising) exposure/Taiwan pr. [pu4 guang1]
to expose (to the air, light etc)/to leave uncovered/exposure
to expose/to bring to light/to disclose/revelation
to expose/to unmask/to ferret out/to disclose/disclosure
lit. chasing the wind and clutching at shadows (idiom); fig. groundless accusations/to act on hearsay evidence
to be thoroughly discredited/to fall into disrepute
to make known to the masses (idiom); to publicize widely/to let the world know
to log out (computer)/to publish/to be published/to appear (in a newspaper etc)
(of a plot etc) to fall through and stand exposed
